FuncDef:
The access user-group outbound enable command enables downstream packets to carry the source user's user-group ID in upstream packets.
The undo access user-group outbound enable command disables downstream packets from carrying the source user's user-group ID in upstream packets.
By default, downstream packets do not carry the source user's user-group ID in upstream packets.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In user-to-user scenarios, to match downstream packets against UCLs based on the source user's user-group ID, run the access user-group outbound enable command to allow downstream packets to carry the source user's user-group ID in upstream packets. By default, downstream packets do not carry the source user's user-group ID. Therefore, downstream packets cannot be matched against UCLs based on the source user's user-group ID.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
